channel.title: CVE Feed for Tenable -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Tenable -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-1142|2024-08-05T03:51:48.845Z -- tenable -- tenable%20appliance
item.description: Tenable Appliance versions 4.6.1 and earlier have been found to contain a single XSS vulnerability. Utilizing a specially crafted request, an authenticated attacker could potentially execute arbitrary JavaScript code by manipulating certain URL parameters related to offline plugins.

item.title: CVE-2018-1141|2024-08-05T03:51:48.788Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: When installing Nessus to a directory outside of the default location, Nessus versions prior to 7.0.3 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the installation location.

item.title: CVE-2018-1148|2024-08-05T03:51:48.919Z -- tenable -- tenable%20nessus
item.description: In Nessus before 7.1.0, Session Fixation exists due to insufficient session management within the application. An authenticated attacker could maintain system access due to session fixation after a user password change.

item.title: CVE-2018-1147|2024-08-05T03:51:48.992Z -- tenable -- tenable%20nessus
item.description: In Nessus before 7.1.0, a XSS vulnerability exists due to improper input validation. A remote authenticated attacker could create and upload a .nessus file, which may be viewed by an administrator allowing for the execution of arbitrary script code in a user's browser session. In other scenarios, XSS could also occur by altering variables from the Advanced Settings.

item.title: CVE-2018-1153|2024-08-05T03:51:48.840Z -- tenable -- burp%20suite%20community%20edition
item.description: Burp Suite Community Edition 1.7.32 and 1.7.33 fail to validate the server certificate in a couple of HTTPS requests which allows a man in the middle to modify or view traffic.

item.title: CVE-2018-1154|2024-08-05T03:51:48.873Z -- tenable -- securitycenter
item.description: In SecurityCenter versions prior to 5.7.0, a username enumeration issue could allow an unauthenticated attacker to automate the discovery of username aliases via brute force, ultimately facilitating unauthorized access. Server response output has been unified to correct this issue.

item.title: CVE-2018-1152|2024-08-05T03:51:48.761Z -- tenable -- libjpeg-turbo
item.description: libjpeg-turbo 1.5.90 is vulnerable to a denial of service vulnerability caused by a divide by zero when processing a crafted BMP image.

item.title: CVE-2018-1155|2024-08-05T03:51:48.853Z -- tenable -- securitycenter
item.description: In SecurityCenter versions prior to 5.7.0, a cross-site scripting (XSS) issue could allow an authenticated attacker to inject JavaScript code into an image filename parameter within the Reports feature area. Properly updated input validation techniques have been implemented to correct this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-3290|2024-08-01T20:05:08.393Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: A race condition vulnerability exists where an authenticated, local attacker on a Windows Nessus host could modify installation parameters at installation time, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Nessus host

item.title: CVE-2024-3291|2024-08-01T20:05:08.354Z -- tenable -- nessus%20agent
item.description: When installing Nessus Agent to a directory outside of the default location on a Windows host, Nessus Agent versions prior to 10.6.4 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.title: CVE-2024-3232|2024-08-01T20:05:08.350Z -- tenable -- tenable%20identity%20exposure
item.description: A formula injection vulnerability exists in Tenable Identity Exposure where an authenticated remote attacker with administrative privileges could manipulate application form fields in order to trick another administrator into executing CSV payloads. - CVE-2024-3232

item.title: CVE-2024-3292|2024-08-01T20:05:08.226Z -- tenable -- nessus%20agent
item.description: A race condition vulnerability exists where an authenticated, local attacker on a Windows Nessus Agent host could modify installation parameters at installation time, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Nessus host. - CVE-2024-3292

item.title: CVE-2024-3289|2024-08-01T20:05:08.242Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: When installing Nessus to a directory outside of the default location on a Windows host, Nessus versions prior to 10.7.3 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.title: CVE-2024-1891|2024-08-01T18:56:22.481Z -- tenable -- security%20center
item.description: A stored cross site scripting vulnerability exists in Tenable Security Center where an authenticated, remote attacker could inject HTML code into a web application scan result page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1471|2024-08-01T18:40:21.183Z -- tenable -- security%20center
item.description: An HTML injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, remote attacker with administrator privileges on the Security Center application could modify Repository parameters, which could lead to HTML redirection attacks.

item.title: CVE-2024-1683|2024-08-01T18:48:21.833Z -- tenable -- tenable%20identity%20exposure%20secure%20relay
item.description: A DLL injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, low-privileged local attacker could modify application files on the TIE Secure Relay host, which could allow for overriding of the configuration and running of new Secure Relay services.

item.title: CVE-2024-1367|2024-08-01T18:40:19.949Z -- tenable -- security%20center
item.description: A command injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, remote attacker with administrator privileges on the Security Center application could modify Logging parameters, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Security Center host.

item.title: CVE-2024-3232|2024-07-16T17:02:19.000Z -- tenable -- tenable%20identity%20exposure
item.description: A formula injection vulnerability exists in Tenable Identity Exposure where an authenticated remote attacker with administrative privileges could manipulate application form fields in order to trick another administrator into executing CSV payloads. - CVE-2024-3232

item.title: CVE-2024-1891|2024-06-12T15:56:41.242Z -- tenable -- security%20center
item.description: A stored cross site scripting vulnerability exists in Tenable Security Center where an authenticated, remote attacker could inject HTML code into a web application scan result page.

item.title: CVE-2024-5759|2024-06-12T16:00:26.228Z -- tenable -- security%20center
item.description: An improper privilege management vulnerability exists in Tenable Security Center where an authenticated, remote attacker could view unauthorized objects and launch scans without having the required privileges

item.title: CVE-2024-2390|2024-03-18T15:37:44.698Z -- tenable -- nessus%20agent
item.description: As a part of Tenable’s vulnerability disclosure program, a vulnerability in a Nessus plugin was identified and reported. This vulnerability could allow a malicious actor with sufficient permissions on a scan target to place a binary in a specific filesystem location, and abuse the impacted plugin in order to escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-3289|2024-06-06T17:35:56.532Z -- tenable -- nessus
item.description: When installing Nessus to a directory outside of the default location on a Windows host, Nessus versions prior to 10.7.3 did not enforce secure permissions for sub-directories. This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.title: CVE-2024-3292|2024-06-06T17:36:24.005Z -- tenable -- nessus%20agent
item.description: A race condition vulnerability exists where an authenticated, local attacker on a Windows Nessus Agent host could modify installation parameters at installation time, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on the Nessus host. - CVE-2024-3292

This could allow for local privilege escalation if users had not secured the directories in the non-default installation location.

item.description: An HTML injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, remote attacker with administrator privileges on the Security Center application could modify Repository parameters, which could lead to HTML redirection attacks.

item.description: A DLL injection vulnerability exists where an authenticated, low-privileged local attacker could modify application files on the TIE Secure Relay host, which could allow for overriding of the configuration and running of new Secure Relay services.

item.description: An improper privilege management vulnerability exists in Tenable Security Center where an authenticated, remote attacker could view unauthorized objects and launch scans without having the required privileges

item.description: A stored cross site scripting vulnerability exists in Tenable Security Center where an authenticated, remote attacker could inject HTML code into a web application scan result page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2390|2024-08-01T19:11:53.526Z -- tenable -- nessus%20agent
item.description: As a part of Tenable’s vulnerability disclosure program, a vulnerability in a Nessus plugin was identified and reported. This vulnerability could allow a malicious actor with sufficient permissions on a scan target to place a binary in a specific filesystem location, and abuse the impacted plugin in order to escalate privileges.
